title: Software Engineer
description:
**About NetApp**
 NetApp is the intelligent data infrastructure company, turning a world of disruption into opportunity for every customer. No matter the data type, workload or environment, we help our customers identify and realize new business possibilities. And it all starts with our people.
   

  

 If this sounds like something you want to be part of, NetApp is the place for you. You can help bring new ideas to life, approaching each challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, you won't be doing it alone. At NetApp, we're all about asking for help when we need it, collaborating with others, and partnering across the organization \\- and beyond.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are looking for a full stack engineer to join NetApp’s
 **Marketplace Core** 
 team. In this role, you will design and implement user experiences that integrate NetApp’s products with all major cloud marketplaces, like
 **Azure, Azure, and** 
**Google Cloud Platform (GCP)** 
 . You’ll work across the stack (front\\-end and back\\-end) to build modern features that
 **accelerate time\\-to\\-value** 
 for customers, enabling them to quickly deploy and benefit from NetApp solutions on their cloud platform of choice. This position offers the opportunity to work on cutting\\-edge cloud integration projects, collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, and directly impact customer adoption and satisfaction across multiple cloud environments
   

  

 Job Responsibilities
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* Design and deliver complex cloud\\-native applications that meet performance, scale, and reliability requirements.
* Strong skills in front\\-end development using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript/TypeScript. Hands\\-on experience with modern front\\-end frameworks or libraries such as React or Angular, including building responsive and dynamic user interfaces.
* Solid programming experience in server\\-side languages and frameworks (e.g., Node.js, Python, Java, Golang or RUST). Proven ability to develop RESTful APIs or microservices, work with web frameworks, and integrate with databases (SQL and/or NoSQL)
* Collaborate closely with team members to integrate systems and ensure high\\-quality deliverables for customer success.
* Build modern CI/CD infrastructure that reliably supports several hundred developers working on interconnected software deployment pipelines.
* Actively mentor and groom new hires and other team members to build a strong and cohesive team.
* Work as part of a larger team, collaborating closely with team members and leadership to ensure overall team objectives are met as ONE team. Your partnership with other team members will be crucial to the success of all customer deliverables.


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Direct experience integrating or publishing software on cloud marketplaces (Azure, AWS or GCP) is a plus. Familiarity with the specific processes, APIs, or developer portals of these marketplaces can help you ramp up quickly.
* Knowledge of enterprise storage, data management, or cloud infrastructure solutions. Experience with NetApp products or similar technologies is beneficial but not required.
* Experience with containerization and deployment tools such as Docker and Kubernetes, and infrastructure\\-as\\-code tools (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation).
* Understanding of security best practices in web and cloud development, including authentication/authorization (OAuth, SSO), encryption, and compliance standards. Ability to incorporate security considerations into the development lifecycle of marketplace features.


 Job Requirements
   

  

* 5\\+ years of industry experience in software development.
* 2\\+ years of experience in data management systems and storage platforms for managing and storing data across various workloads and environments.
* 2\\+ years of expert\\-level hands\\-on experience in fault\\-tolerant, highly scalable cloud architectures, including service\\-oriented architectures, cloud\\-native (FAAS, PAAS), and cloud storage services with at least one hyperscaler (Azure, AWS, GCP).


 At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in\\-office and/or in\\-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, and any protected classification.
   

  

**Why NetApp?**
 We are all about helping customers turn challenges into business opportunity. It starts with bringing new thinking to age\\-old problems, like how to use data most effectively to run better \\- but also to innovate. We tailor our approach to the customer's unique needs with a combination of fresh thinking and proven approaches.
   

  

 We enable a healthy work\\-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off each year to volunteer with their favourite organizations. We provide comprehensive benefits, including health care, life and accident plans, emotional support resources for you and your family, legal services, and financial savings programs to help you plan for your future. We support professional and personal growth through educational assistance and provide access to various discounts and perks to enhance your overall quality of life.
   

  

 If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.

title: TechOps Engineer
job_function: Information Technology, Engineering, and Customer Service
description:
**About us**




  





 Aquanow is a trading and technology company powering the next generation of financial services. We’re at the forefront of the rapidly evolving digital asset space, empowering businesses to navigate the complexities of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technologies. As a leading provider of infrastructure solutions, we offer innovative services in cryptocurrency trading, liquidity management, and secure digital asset storage. Our platform is built to deliver seamless, scalable, and reliable solutions that cater to the needs of institutional clients and businesses seeking to unlock the potential of digital finance. Aquanow is committed to driving growth and shaping the future of the digital economy by offering unparalleled opportunities for innovation and advancement in the world of digital assets.
 



  





 With rapid global expansion, we have established offices in Vancouver, Toronto, Dubai, Malaysia, Turkey, and beyond. Our international customer base includes some of the world’s fastest\\-growing fintech companies and leading financial institutions.
 



  





**Your Contribution to Our Growth**




  





 This TechOps Engineer is responsible for support, administering and monitoring our production environments. This is a unique opportunity to work alongside a highly experienced team and contribute to the development of a high\\-growth trading and technology company.
 



  





 As a TechOps Engineer at Aquanow, you’ll be at the heart of a fast\\-moving, global organization powering the digital asset revolution for institutional and enterprise clients. This opportunity offers a unique opportunity to dive deep into our production environment and get a full 360° view of our platform—from frontend applications and backend systems, all the way to blockchain infrastructure. You’ll be responsible for support, administering and monitoring our production environments. You'll gain hands\\-on exposure to the full spectrum of technical operations, becoming a critical point of escalation for troubleshooting live issues, analyzing logs and metrics, and helping to drive platform stability for a diverse, global client base.
 



  





 In this role, you'll leverage powerful observability tools, infrastructure logs, and custom dashboards to conduct detailed investigations—resolving bugs or escalating to development teams with rich analysis. If you're a fast learner with strong problem solving skills, and you’re looking to build a solid foundation in a leading crypto trading infrastructure company—this is your chance to make a global impact while sharpening your technical edge.
 



  





 This is a
 **remote, 1\\-year contract role based in Bangalore, India** 
 , with the possibility of extension depending on performance and business needs. You’ll work closely with our global engineering and operations teams to support Aquanow’s production systems and infrastructure.
 



  





**What You’ll Do**




  




* Provide 1st and 2nd level application support for all the virtual assets products hosted on our trading platform, performing detailed troubleshooting and resolving issues in live production environments reported by the customers.
* Perform deep dive analysis using infrastructure and application logs, metrics and traces to identify performance bottlenecks relating to system performance, APIs, websockets, databases.
* Perform code debugging to identify software issues, develop hotfixes and seek peer code review with senior software engineers before deploying into staging and production.
* Observe the application health and manage alerts with the goal to restore normal service operation as quickly as possible and to minimize the impact on business operations.
* Collaborate with the software development teams to build an effective Observability stack to generate logs, metrics, traces and notifications for production services.
* Work with engineering and product teams, as well as other vendors, to test and deploy software updates, license updates and fixes to production.
* Assist with documentation on knowledge base articles, operations manuals, incident and problem management process.



  





**We’d Love to See**




  




* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or other related fields.
* Proficient with at least one programming language (NodeJs, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, C\\#, Bash, etc.).
* 1\\-2 years of experience supporting fintech applications, payment processors, and/or crypto trading platforms etc.
* Extensive experience with AWS and its services (Lambda, Cloudwatch, DynamoDB).
* Experience with Postman for API testing.
* Experience with SQL and/or PostgreSQL.
* Experience with at least 1 observability tool: Coralogix, Grafana, Prometheus, New Relic, Splunk, etc.
* Experience with relational \\& non\\-relational databases (e.g. querying, and performance analysis).
* Experience with CI/CD and deployment pipeline setup and automation (Github actions).
* Fast learner with excellent analytical problem solving and communication skills.
* Have excellent problem solving, time management skills, ability to work independently.



  





  





 At our offices you will find a group of people that embrace diversity and value performance over pedigree. Every day we draw value from the diverse experiences of our team whose backgrounds include top financial institutions, tech companies and untraditional backgrounds. Our success comes from identifying exceptional people and providing them with the platform to reach their true potential. Even if you feel you may not meet all the job requirements, we encourage you to apply!
 



  





 Aquanow is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, qualified veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other unlawful criterion or circumstance.
